calibration.note: Contract does not embed calibration scores. Actual calibration managed via src/farfan_core/core/calibration/ + config/intrinsic_calibration.json + config/fusion_specification.json

assembly_rules.description: Combine all evidence elements from multiple method invocations
Aggregate confidence scores across all methods
Combine pattern matches from text mining methods
Combine metadata from all multiple methods for full traceability

evidence.description: Legacy-compatible evidence dict with elements, by_type, confidence_scores

by_type.description: Count of elements by evidence type

fallback_strategy.note: No fallback strategies enabled. All failures propagate according to error_handling configuration.

assembly_flow.step_1_method_execution: multiple methods execute in priority order, outputs stored with dot-notation keys
assembly_flow.step_2_evidence_nexus: EvidenceNexus builds evidence graph, infers relationships, validates consistency
assembly_flow.step_3_validation: ValidationEngine runs graph-theoretic validation, checks completeness
assembly_flow.step_4_carver_synthesis: DoctoralCarverSynthesizer generates PhD-level narrative from evidence graph
assembly_flow.step_5_output_generation: Phase2QuestionResult with evidence (legacy), synthesized_answer, human_readable_output, graph_statistics

contradictions.interpretation: No statistical contradictions in quantitative claims

elements.source_sentence: según datos de DANE para el año 2022

human_answer_structure.description: Expected structure after Nexus processes method outputs: evidence graph, validation report, synthesized narrative, and legacy-compatible evidence dict

evidence_structure_schema.description: Evidence structure from EvidenceNexus after graph construction, validation, and Carver synthesis

elements.description: Evidence nodes (EvidenceNode objects serialized) from evidence graph built by Nexus
elements.example_count: Expected 15-50 elements for a complete diagnostic

financial_summary.description: Aggregated financial data from FinancialAuditor and PDETMunicipalPlanAnalyzer

pattern_matches.description: Aggregated pattern matches from text mining methods

template_variable_bindings.description: Variables available from EvidenceNexus output for templates (legacy + new fields)

variables.{score}: Calculated by Phase 3 scorer from overall_confidence
variables.{synthesized_answer.gaps}: List of critical gaps from Carver analysis

usage_notes.architecture_notes: EvidenceNexus REPLACED by EvidenceNexus (graph-native reasoning). Manual assembly_rules REPLACED by causal graph construction + Dempster-Shafer inference. Template-based output REPLACED by DoctoralCarverSynthesizer (PhD-level narrative generation).
usage_notes.for_auditors: Full traceability: method outputs → evidence graph (SHA-256 hashed nodes) → belief propagation → validation report → doctoral narrative with citations.
usage_notes.for_developers: This structure shows the expected output after BaseExecutorWithContract._execute_v3() → EvidenceNexus.process() → DoctoralCarverSynthesizer.synthesize() completes the full pipeline: method execution, graph construction, validation, and narrative synthesis.
usage_notes.for_validators: Verify that actual execution produces: evidence (legacy compatible), synthesized_answer (full narrative), human_readable_output (Carver-formatted), overall_confidence and completeness for Phase 3 scoring.

validation_against_expected_elements.overall_validation_result: PASS - All required and minimum elements present

method_binding.note: All multiple methods extracted from D1_Q1_Executor in executors.py

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Triangulation across heterogeneous sources with explicit uncertainty.
epistemological_foundation.justification: Chosen because INSUMOS in PA01 must explain why the plan's commitments are coherent, measurable, and traceable to evidence.
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Policy plans encode mechanisms via activities, outputs, and indicators; evidence is treated as fallible observations of underlying commitments.
theoretical_framework: Pearl (2009) causal reasoning (why mechanisms matter)
Pawson & Tilley (1997) realistic evaluation
Results-based management for public policy monitoring

technical_approach.algorithm: pattern extraction + multi-method pipeline + evidence graph synthesis
assumptions: The source plan contains at least one relevant section or table for this question.
Expected element types map to observable text spans or tabular cells.
technical_approach.complexity: O(n_patterns × n_text) for bounded regex matching + O(n_nodes + n_edges) for graph propagation.
limitations: Evidence quality depends on document structure and explicitness of commitments.
Pattern-only extraction is conservative to preserve determinism.

steps.description: Extract candidate claims and table structures from the document using contract patterns and policy-area scope.
Populate method outputs under provides slots and construct evidence nodes aligned to expected_elements.
Assemble aggregate evidence for elements_found and infer relationships to support synthesis and validation.
Compute completeness, gaps, and confidence interval for Q001/D1-Q1.

method_combination_logic.combination_strategy: Sequential multi-method pipeline with evidence fusion
method_combination_logic.confidence_aggregation: Final confidence per evidence element = weighted_mean([confidence_method1, confidence_method2, ...]) where weights reflect method reliability (e.g., Bayesian methods have higher weight than simple regex).
method_combination_logic.evidence_fusion: Evidence from all multiple methods is transformed into EvidenceNode objects by EvidenceNexus. Overlapping evidence (same content hash) is deduplicated via SHA-256. Belief masses are combined via Dempster-Shafer fusion, confidence intervals via belief propagation.
method_combination_logic.execution_order: Methods execute in priority order (1→17). Later methods can access outputs of earlier methods (e.g., method 7 uses goals extracted by method 6).
method_combination_logic.rationale: D1-Q1 requires comprehensive extraction of quantitative baseline data from multiple sources (text, tables, causal links). The multiple methods cover complementary aspects: text mining (methods 1-5), goal extraction (6-7), financial analysis (8-10), contradiction detection (11-13), Bayesian inference (14-15), and semantic processing (16-17).
trade_offs: Comprehensiveness vs. Complexity: multiple methods ensure thorough coverage but increase computational cost and maintenance burden
Precision vs. Recall: Multiple methods increase recall (find more evidence) but may introduce redundancy; deduplication and confidence weighting mitigate this
Interpretability vs. Sophistication: Bayesian and embedding methods are powerful but less transparent than regex; human_readable_output compensates via methodological documentation

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Empirical-interpretive: Knowledge about policy mechanisms emerges from detecting linguistic markers of causality in policy documents
epistemological_foundation.justification: Diagnosing critical causal links in baseline diagnostics reveals whether policymakers understand the causal pathways between gender inequalities and their determinants
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Texts contain latent causal structures that can be detected through linguistic patterns indicating causal relationships (because, therefore, leads to, etc.)
epistemological_foundation.paradigm: Critical text mining with causal link detection
theoretical_framework: Causal discourse analysis: Texts reveal causal beliefs through specific linguistic constructions (Fairclough, 2003)
Theory of change reconstruction: Policy documents implicitly encode theories of change that can be extracted via causal link detection (Weiss, 1995)

actionable_insights: If few critical links found: Diagnosis lacks causal depth, may be purely descriptive
If many links but low criticality: Diagnosis discusses tangential issues, not core gender inequalities

interpretation_guide.high_criticality: ≥0.8: Link directly connects to gender inequality outcomes

output_structure.critical_links: List of detected causal links with source/target entities
output_structure.link_scores: Criticality scores (0-1) based on relevance to gender outcomes

technical_approach.algorithm: Multi-pattern regex matching with context window analysis
assumptions: Causal language reflects causal understanding
Critical links mention gender-related outcomes
limitations: Cannot detect implicit causality without linguistic markers
May miss causal relationships expressed across distant sentences

steps.description: Identify causal connectors (porque, por lo tanto, conduce a, genera, resulta en)
Extract entities before and after connector (cause → effect)
Classify link criticality based on proximity to gender indicators

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Coherentist: A causal link is epistemically justified if it coheres with surrounding textual evidence
epistemological_foundation.justification: Detecting a causal connector alone is insufficient; analyzing surrounding text validates whether the link is substantive or superficial
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: The meaning and validity of a causal claim depends on its textual context (surrounding sentences, semantic coherence)
theoretical_framework: Semantic coherence theory: Valid claims are embedded in coherent semantic contexts
Evidential reasoning: Context provides supporting or undermining evidence for causal claims

actionable_insights: Low coherence + many links: Document has scattered causal claims without substantiation
High coherence: Causal claims are evidence-based and well-argued

interpretation_guide.low_coherence: <0.5: Link may be spurious or poorly contextualized

output_structure.contradicting_evidence: Contextual sentences that contradict the link
output_structure.supporting_evidence: Contextual sentences that support the link

technical_approach.algorithm: Extract ±N sentences around link, analyze semantic consistency
assumptions: Coherent contexts indicate valid causal claims
Context window of ±3 sentences captures relevant information
technical_approach.complexity: O(k*w) where k=links, w=context window size
limitations: May miss long-range dependencies beyond context window
Semantic similarity doesn't guarantee logical validity

steps.description: Extract context window (±3 sentences) around detected causal link
Calculate semantic similarity between link and context using embeddings
Identify supporting/contradicting evidence in context

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Structuralism: Policy knowledge is organized according to hierarchical structures that determine meaning
epistemological_foundation.justification: Gender policy baselines must be extracted systematically to ensure comparability across municipalities and policy cycles
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Policy documents follow recognizable structural patterns (policy pillars, strategic objectives, action lines) that can be systematically extracted
epistemological_foundation.paradigm: Structured policy analysis with industrial rigor
theoretical_framework: Policy architecture theory: Effective policies have clear structural organization
Industrial-grade analysis: Systematic, replicable methods ensure consistency across documents

actionable_insights: Incomplete structure: Municipality may lack technical capacity for formal policy design
Complete structure but no baseline data: Structural compliance without substantive content

interpretation_guide.incomplete_structure: <0.5: Document lacks standard structure, may be disorganized

output_structure.extracted_segments: Hierarchical dict of policy structure → content
output_structure.structural_completeness: Score indicating presence of expected structural elements

technical_approach.algorithm: Multi-level pattern matching with structural validation
assumptions: Policy documents follow standard Colombian municipal planning structures
Structural markers are consistently used
technical_approach.complexity: O(n*m) where n=document sections, m=pattern types
limitations: Fails on highly non-standard document structures
Cannot process purely narrative documents without structural markers

steps.description: Identify policy structure markers (pillar headers, objective numbering)
Extract content within each structural segment
Match predefined policy patterns (baseline data, targets, indicators)
Validate structural completeness and coherence

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Linguistic realism: Specific phrases reliably indicate policy elements (e.g., 'línea base' indicates baseline data)
epistemological_foundation.justification: Sentence-level granularity ensures precise localization of policy elements for traceability and validation
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Policy commitments and evidence are encoded at sentence level through specific linguistic patterns
theoretical_framework: Information extraction theory: Structured information can be extracted from unstructured text via pattern recognition

actionable_insights: Sentences with multiple pattern types (e.g., baseline + source + indicator): High-quality evidence
Matches concentrated in few sentences: Evidence is localized, not systemic

interpretation_guide.dense_matches: Many matches per sentence: Rich informational content
interpretation_guide.sparse_matches: Few matches: Document may lack expected policy elements

technical_approach.algorithm: Apply pattern registry to each sentence, collect matches with positions
assumptions: Sentence boundaries are correctly detected
Patterns comprehensively cover expected phrasings
limitations: Misses patterns spanning multiple sentences
Regex cannot handle complex syntactic variations

steps.description: Segment document into sentences
For each sentence, apply all relevant regex patterns
Record matches with sentence ID, start/end positions, matched text

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Logical atomism: Understanding complex evidence requires breaking it into elementary propositions
epistemological_foundation.justification: Extracting point-level evidence allows detailed auditing and prevents conflating distinct claims
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Complex policy evidence can be decomposed into atomic 'points' (individual data claims, sources, indicators)
theoretical_framework: Evidence granularity theory: Fine-grained evidence units enable precise validation and reuse

actionable_insights: Many quantitative points + few sources: Data without provenance
Balanced distribution: Comprehensive evidence base

technical_approach.algorithm: Identify and isolate individual evidence points (numbers, sources, indicators)
assumptions: Evidence points can be meaningfully isolated from context
Each point has a primary classification
limitations: Decontextualization may lose nuance
Complex evidence may not fit atomic model

steps.description: Detect evidence units (numeric values, entity names, temporal references)
Extract unit with minimal context (subject, predicate)
Classify unit type (quantitative_indicator, official_source, temporal_marker)

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Intentionalism: Understanding policy requires identifying intended goals
epistemological_foundation.justification: Baseline diagnostics should connect data to goals (e.g., 'reduce VBG by X%'); extracting goals enables evaluating this connection
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Policies are goal-directed interventions; goals are explicitly or implicitly stated desired outcomes
theoretical_framework: Means-ends rationality: Policies are structured around goals (ends) and actions (means)
Theory of change: Goals are nodes in causal pathways from inputs to impacts

actionable_insights: Goals without baseline data: Targets lack empirical foundation
Goals aligned with baseline indicators: Evidence-based planning

technical_approach.algorithm: Identify goal markers (reducir, aumentar, lograr) + target entity + quantifier
assumptions: Goals are expressed with standard verbs
Goals have identifiable objects and quantifiers
limitations: Misses implicit goals
May confuse aspirational language with concrete goals

steps.description: Detect goal verbs (reducir, incrementar, alcanzar)
Extract object of goal verb (what is to be reduced/increased)
Extract quantifier if present (percentage, absolute number)

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Contextualism: Goal meaning depends on context
epistemological_foundation.justification: A goal like 'reduce VBG' is ambiguous without context (by how much? by when? who is responsible?)
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Goals are situated in policy contexts that specify conditions, timeframes, and responsible actors
theoretical_framework: Situated policy analysis: Goals must be understood in their institutional and temporal context

actionable_insights: Goals without temporal context: No deadline, low accountability
Goals without responsible actors: Diffused responsibility

interpretation_guide.complete_context: All three dimensions present: Well-specified goal

output_structure.goal_contexts: Dict mapping goal_id → {temporal, spatial, actor} context

technical_approach.algorithm: Extract temporal, spatial, and actor context around identified goals
assumptions: Context is proximal to goal statement
Context markers use standard terminology
limitations: May miss context stated in distant document sections
Cannot infer implicit context

steps.description: For each goal, extract surrounding context window
Identify temporal markers (plazo, 2024-2027)
Identify responsible actors (Secretaría de...)
Identify spatial scope (municipal, rural, etc.)

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Representationalism: Textual representations of amounts map to objective financial realities
epistemological_foundation.justification: Gender policies require budget backing; extracting financial amounts enables assessing resource adequacy
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Financial commitments are expressed as monetary amounts in various formats (text, numbers, currencies)
theoretical_framework: Financial accountability: Budget transparency requires extracting and verifying financial allocations

actionable_insights: Many amounts but low confidence: Financial data is poorly formatted
No amounts found: Budget information missing from diagnosis

technical_approach.algorithm: Detect numeric patterns, parse to float, normalize units (thousands, millions)
assumptions: Amounts follow Colombian formatting conventions (. as thousands separator)
Units are explicitly stated or inferable from context
limitations: May fail on non-standard formats
Cannot verify accuracy of stated amounts

steps.description: Detect amount patterns ($ X.XXX.XXX, X millones)
Parse numeric component to float
Identify unit (millones, mil millones) and multiply
Normalize to standard unit (e.g., COP)

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Domain-specific realism: Financial data extraction must account for PDET-specific terminologies and structures
epistemological_foundation.justification: PDET municipalities may use specific financial categories (PAC, SGR) requiring specialized extraction
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: PDET plans have specific financial reporting requirements and structures
epistemological_foundation.paradigm: Context-specific financial analysis for PDET municipalities
theoretical_framework: Institutional context sensitivity: Policy analysis tools must adapt to specific institutional frameworks (PDET)

actionable_insights: Uncategorized amounts: Budget detail without transparency on funding source
Heavy reliance on specific source (e.g., all from SGR): Diversification risk

interpretation_guide.categorized: Amount linked to financial category (e.g., SGR)
interpretation_guide.uncategorized: Amount found but no category detected

technical_approach.algorithm: Augment generic financial parsing with PDET-specific patterns
assumptions: PDET plans mention financial categories near amounts
Category terminology is standardized
limitations: Limited to known PDET financial categories
Cannot extract amounts from complex table formats without table parsing

steps.description: Apply generic amount parsing
Detect PDET-specific financial categories (SGR, regalías, PAC)
Link amounts to categories based on proximity

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Structural realism: Tables encode structured financial information requiring specialized parsing
epistemological_foundation.justification: Tables contain dense, structured financial data that cannot be extracted via sentence-level text mining
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Budget data is often presented in tables with rows (programs/projects) and columns (years/amounts)
epistemological_foundation.paradigm: Structured data extraction from tabular formats
theoretical_framework: Information architecture: Tabular formats embed relational structures (rows, columns, cells) that determine information retrieval strategies

actionable_insights: Multi-year budget tables: Indicates planning horizon and resource trajectory
Single-year tables: Short-term planning, no long-term resource commitment

interpretation_guide.complete_tables: All expected columns present: Comprehensive budget detail

technical_approach.algorithm: Detect table structures, parse rows/columns, extract cell values
assumptions: Tables follow standard row-column format
Headers are identifiable
Amounts are in consistent column positions
limitations: Fails on complex nested tables
May misparse poorly formatted tables
Cannot extract from image-based tables without OCR

steps.description: Detect table markers (HTML <table>, Markdown tables, aligned whitespace)
Parse table structure (identify headers, rows, columns)
Extract cells containing financial amounts
Link amounts to row labels (program names) and column labels (years)

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Logical consistency checking: Policy documents should be internally consistent in their quantitative claims
epistemological_foundation.justification: Extracting quantitative claims enables detecting contradictions that signal data quality issues or errors
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Policies make quantitative claims (e.g., 'VBG rate is 15%') that can be contradictory or inconsistent
theoretical_framework: Coherence theory of justification: Contradictory claims undermine policy credibility

actionable_insights: Contradictory claims: Data quality issue or conceptual confusion
Consistent claims: Internal coherence of baseline data

interpretation_guide.duplicate_subjects: Multiple claims about same subject: Check for contradictions

output_structure.claims: List of {subject, value, unit, sentence_id, confidence}

technical_approach.algorithm: Extract statements with quantifiers, normalize for comparison
assumptions: Quantitative claims have standard subject-predicate-value structure
Same subjects are referred to consistently (no synonyms)
limitations: Cannot resolve synonyms (tasa de VBG vs. violencia de género)
May extract claims that are not meant to be factual (hypothetical scenarios)

steps.description: Identify quantitative statements (X es Y%, la tasa de X es Y)
Parse subject (X) and value (Y)
Store as structured claim {subject, predicate, value}

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Objectivism about numbers: Numeric values have objective meanings independent of representation
epistemological_foundation.justification: Detecting contradictions requires comparing numbers; parsing ensures accurate comparison
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Numbers are objective entities that must be correctly parsed for valid comparisons
theoretical_framework: Formal semantics of numbers: Numerical representations map to abstract mathematical objects

actionable_insights: Low parsing confidence: Document uses non-standard number formatting

technical_approach.algorithm: Handle multiple numeric formats, convert to standard float
assumptions: Colombian format conventions (. for thousands, , for decimals or vice versa depending on context)
limitations: Ambiguity in separator usage (1.234 could be 1234 or 1.234)
May fail on non-standard formats

steps.description: Detect numeric patterns (12.5%, 1.234, 1,234.56)
Normalize separators (. vs , for decimals/thousands)
Convert to float, preserve precision

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Statistical inference: Use hypothesis testing to distinguish signal from noise
epistemological_foundation.justification: Not all numeric discrepancies are meaningful; statistical testing prevents false alarms from minor variations
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Observed differences between claimed values may be due to sampling error or genuine contradictions
theoretical_framework: Frequentist statistics: p-values quantify evidence against null hypothesis (no difference)
Error control: Significance testing controls Type I error (false positive contradictions)

actionable_insights: Significant contradictions: Data quality problem requiring investigation
Non-significant differences: Likely rounding or measurement error

output_structure.test_results: List of {claim1_id, claim2_id, difference, p_value, significant}

technical_approach.algorithm: Apply t-test or chi-square test to compare claimed values
assumptions: Measurement errors are normally distributed
Alpha = 0.05 is appropriate threshold
technical_approach.complexity: O(n²) for pairwise comparisons of n claims
limitations: Requires error estimates (often unavailable in policy documents)
Significance ≠ practical importance

steps.description: For each pair of claims about same subject, compute difference
Estimate measurement error (if metadata available)
Perform significance test (H0: difference = 0)
Flag contradiction if p < 0.05

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Bayesian epistemology: Knowledge is represented as probability distributions updated via Bayes' theorem
epistemological_foundation.justification: Policy baselines often come from small samples or imperfect data; Bayesian methods quantify uncertainty properly
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Policy metrics (e.g., VBG rates) are uncertain quantities with probability distributions, not point estimates
theoretical_framework: Bayesian inference: Prior beliefs + data → posterior beliefs
Uncertainty quantification: Bayesian methods explicitly model uncertainty

actionable_insights: Wide credible intervals: Baseline estimates unreliable, strengthen data collection
Posterior far from prior: Data strongly updates beliefs

output_structure.posterior_distribution: Full posterior (if needed for downstream analysis)

technical_approach.algorithm: Combine prior distribution with observed data to compute posterior
assumptions: Prior is appropriate for metric domain
Data generation process matches likelihood model
technical_approach.complexity: O(MCMC iterations) for non-conjugate, O(1) for conjugate
limitations: Prior choice affects results (subjective)
Computational cost for non-conjugate models

steps.description: Specify prior distribution for metric (e.g., Beta for rates)
Incorporate observed data (e.g., count of VBG cases, population)
Compute posterior distribution via conjugate updates or MCMC
Extract posterior mean, credible intervals

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Probabilistic comparison: Compare posterior distributions, not point estimates
epistemological_foundation.justification: Ranking municipalities by baseline indicators requires proper uncertainty quantification to avoid spurious rankings
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Comparing municipalities or policy cycles requires accounting for uncertainty in all estimates
theoretical_framework: Bayesian model comparison: Quantify probability that policy A > policy B
Decision theory: Bayesian methods support rational decision-making under uncertainty

actionable_insights: High overlap despite different point estimates: Differences not meaningful given uncertainty
Clear separation: Confident ranking

technical_approach.algorithm: Compute P(metric_A > metric_B | data) from posterior samples
assumptions: Posteriors are correctly specified
Sufficient samples for stable probability estimate
technical_approach.complexity: O(S) where S=number of posterior samples
limitations: Requires posterior samples (computational cost)
Interpretation requires Bayesian literacy

steps.description: Obtain posterior distributions for both policies
Draw samples from both posteriors
Compute proportion of samples where policy A > policy B
Report probability and effect size

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Pragmatism: Chunking strategies are justified by their utility for downstream tasks (embedding, retrieval)
epistemological_foundation.justification: Semantic search and embedding require chunked text; good chunking preserves semantic units (paragraphs, sections)
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Long documents must be divided into chunks that fit neural model context windows while preserving semantic coherence
theoretical_framework: Information retrieval: Chunk granularity affects retrieval precision and recall
Neural model constraints: Transformer models have fixed context windows requiring chunking

actionable_insights: Chunk boundaries split semantic units: Consider different chunking strategy
Chunks align with document structure: Good chunking

interpretation_guide.many_small_chunks: Document is dense or highly structured

technical_approach.algorithm: Chunk by paragraph/section with overlap to preserve context
assumptions: Document has clear structural boundaries
Overlap improves retrieval (empirical assumption)
limitations: Fixed chunk size may split semantic units
Overlap increases storage and computation

steps.description: Identify natural boundaries (paragraphs, sections)
Create chunks respecting boundaries, max N tokens
Add overlap (e.g., 50 tokens) between chunks for continuity

epistemological_foundation.epistemological_stance: Distributional hypothesis: Words/phrases with similar meanings occur in similar contexts, captured by embeddings
epistemological_foundation.justification: Embeddings enable semantic similarity search and clustering beyond keyword matching
epistemological_foundation.ontological_basis: Text meaning can be represented as high-dimensional vectors in semantic space
theoretical_framework: Vector semantics: Meaning is position in vector space
Neural language models: Transformers learn contextual representations

actionable_insights: Low similarity between baseline and goals: Diagnostic-planning disconnect
High similarity: Coherent evidence-based planning

interpretation_guide.cosine_similarity: Use cosine similarity to compare embeddings

technical_approach.algorithm: Pass text through pretrained transformer, extract embedding vector
assumptions: Pretrained model generalizes to policy domain
Embedding dimensionality (e.g., 768) captures relevant semantics
technical_approach.complexity: O(L) where L=sequence length for transformer forward pass
limitations: Domain shift: Model trained on general text may miss domain-specific nuances
Black box: Embeddings are not directly interpretable

steps.description: Tokenize text for transformer model
Pass through model (e.g., BERT, MPNet)
Extract embedding (e.g., [CLS] token or mean pooling)
Normalize to unit vector

template.title: ## Q001 | Análisis D1-Q1: Línea Base Cuantitativa en Derechos de las Mujeres | Derechos de las mujeres e igualdad de género

cluster_id.description: Cluster de análisis según el monolith, si aplica.

evidence.description: Objeto de evidencia procesado por EvidenceNexus con estructura de grafo y campos legacy-compatible; incluye elements, by_type, confidence_scores, graph_hash.

metadata.description: Metadatos adicionales de la pregunta para consumo posterior.

policy_area_id.description: PA canónica, debe ser coherente con identity.policy_area_id.

question_global.description: Índice global de la pregunta (de questionnaire_monolith).

trace.description: Información de trazabilidad (provenance, logs) específica de la ejecución.

validation.description: Resultado de validaciones lógicas de la respuesta (coherencia, integridad, etc.).

patterns.pattern: línea base|año base|situación inicial|diagnóstico de género

SISPRO: Sistema Integral de Información de la Protección Social
SIVIGILA: Sistema de Vigilancia en Salud Pública

patterns.pattern: Observatorio de Asuntos de Género|Secretaría de la Mujer|Comisaría de Familia
Encuesta Nacional de Demografía y Salud|ENDS
violencia intrafamiliar|VBG|violencia basada en género|delitos sexuales|feminicidio
participación política de las mujeres|mujeres en cargos directivos
serie histórica|evolución 20\d{2}-20\d{2}|tendencia de los últimos|el año pasado|desde \d{4}|tendencia reciente

question_context.policy_area_label: Derechos de las mujeres e igualdad de género
question_context.question_text: ¿El diagnóstico presenta datos numéricos (tasas de VBG, porcentajes de participación, cifras de brechas salariales) para el área de Derechos de las mujeres e igualdad de género que sirvan como línea base? Se debe verificar la presencia de un año de referencia y la mención de fuentes (ej. DANE, Medicina Legal, Observatorio de Género).

signal_requirements.note: Signal requirements enforce minimum quality threshold of 0.5. Mandatory signals must be present with sufficient strength for execution to proceed.

traceability.provenance_note: This contract was generated with full multi-method orchestration support. The method_binding.methods array contains all multiple methods from D1_Q1_QuantitativeBaselineExtractor, and human_answer_structure documents the expected evidence output after execution.

rules.description: Auto-generated: require all required expected_elements types
Auto-generated: encourage optional evidence types when available
